title: A matrix is a rectangular array of numbers arranged in rows and columns. Matrices are often used to represent systems of linear equations, especially when dealing with large systems.

A system of linear equations can be represented by a matrix, but not every matrix corresponds directly to a system of linear equations. For a matrix to represent a system of linear equations, the matrix must have specific properties, particularly if it is an augmented matrix or a coefficient matrix. The matrix must represent the coefficients of the variables in a system of equations, and optionally include the constants from the right-hand side of the equations.
